page.title: omniORB development
page.head: omniORB development
page.p: omniORB development happens in Subversion. See the omniORB SourceForge project page for generic instructions, or browse the repository.

The repository contains the following directories:
branches contains stable branches of omniORB. omniORB and omniORBpy releases are synchronised with each other, so the branches are named after the omniORB release.
branches/4_3 is the current development branch, containing omniORB and omniORBpy 4.3.x.
branches/4_2 is the current stable branch, containing omniORB and omniORBpy 4.2.x.
tags contains tagged releases.
cost contains testing code from the CORBA Open Source Testing project.
trunk contains a very incomplete and unstable development version. Do not use it.
old_* contain old branches and tags resulting from the conversion from CVS.
If you want the latest cut from Subversion without doing a checkout, you can download nightly snapshots of the main branches from this page.

Checkouts are built in the same way as a release. Note that to build omniORBpy on Windows or other platforms using the traditional build system, you must checkout the omniORBpy package within the src/lib directory of an omniORB tree. With the autoconf build on Unix platforms, it can be checked out anywhere.
